intro: Helianthella mexicana var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf helianthella, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
